info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 9:03AM HST until October 02 at 11:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Kauai in Kauai County * Until 1100 AM HST. * At 903 AM HST, radar indicated heavy showers and storms impacting Kauai, with additional moderate to heavy showers developing and moving ashore from the northeast. Peak rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour can be expected. Portions of Kauai have already received over 3 inches in the past 3 hours. Water levels have risen quickly in the Wainiha and Hanalei streams, which will likely continue through the late morning hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lihue, Kapaa, Kalaheo, Kekaha, Princeville, Kilauea, North Fork Wailua Trails, Lawai, Omao, Kokee State Park, Wailua Homesteads, Hanalei, Hanapepe, Wainiha, Na Pali State Park, Koloa, Haena, Waimea, Wailua and Poipu. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1100 AM HST if flooding persists. This Flash Flood Warning replaces the previously issued Flood Advisory that was in effect for The island of Kauai in Kauai County. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
